result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Paul Hasler

records.addlTxt:
1:43 PM Defendant Nicholas Paul Hasler in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Defendant appears, without counsel.

Defendant is trying to get an attorney, explains further.
Complaint was filed last week Thursday.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders Defendant to go to the public defender's office within the next day or two.

Matter to be adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 10/31/22 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1

11:16 AM 
Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant. Defendant Nicholas P Hasler appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of WI. 

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of OWI (2nd) Causing Injury. 
Attorney for the defendant states she is unable to speak on his behalf as he refused to speak with her.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant notes she can not speak on the defendant's behalf.
An officer from the jail notes that the defendant did not refuse to speak with the public defender.
Defendant makes statements regarding bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
